alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 2:36AM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A very cold airmass is in place over northeastern Colorado, and breezy winds will continue to cause dangerous wind chill. Snowfall is diminishing and should end by sunrise, but drifting and blowing snow and snow covered, slick roads will impact the morning commute. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snowfall diminishing, additional accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, the Park Range and northern Gore Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 9 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
